TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebBrowsableAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the designated property of a Web Parts control is displayed in a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control provides a generic user interface (UI) that enables users to edit custom properties on <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> and server controls placed in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase> zones. The editing UI is provided for properties that are marked in the source code with the `WebBrowsable` attribute (from the WebBrowsableAttribute class). When a property is marked with this attribute, a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control creates the editing UI based on the type of the property, and uses a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> object if needed to convert the value in each editing control to the type of the property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the WebBrowsableAttribute attribute to mark a property on a Web Parts control as available to be displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control. This example is part of a larger example found in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> class overview.
[!code-vb[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_203_1.vb)] [!code-cs[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_203_1.cs)]

Docs.exception: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute.Browsable%2A> property set to .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WebBrowsableAttribute constructor is used when the `WebBrowsable` attribute is applied through the attribute declaration `[WebBrowsable()]` in C# or `<WebBrowsable()>` in Visual Basic.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute> attribute to mark a property on a Web Parts control as available to be displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control. The property is set as browsable through the WebBrowsableAttribute constructor. This example is part of a larger example found in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> class overview.
[!code-vb[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_59_1.vb)] [!code-cs[WebParts_PropertyGridEditorPart_Overview#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.webcontr_59_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool browsable) cil managed

Docs.param: A Boolean value indicating whether the property should be displayed in a .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute.Browsable%2A> property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The WebBrowsableAttribute constructor is used when the `WebBrowsable` attribute is applied through the attribute declaration with a Boolean value. To prevent a property from being displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PropertyGridEditorPart> control, the property could be marked with the attribute `[WebBrowsable(false)]` in C# or `<WebBrowsable(false)>` in Visual Basic.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a control should display a specific property of a Web Parts control.
Docs.value: if will display the property; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Browsable property is set through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor.

Docs.summary: Represents an instance of the class with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute.Browsable%2A> property set to the default value, which is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Default field returns the same result as calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebBrowsableAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor and passing `false` as the parameter.
